intro: Ctenitopsis sasakii, commonly known as the Sasakii ctenitopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbel-like clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
